db:abstract.db:para: A straight gauge that displays a value within a range.
This type was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The Gauge control displays a value within some range along a horizontal or vertical axis. It can be thought of as an extension of ProgressBar, providing tickmarks and labels to provide a visual measurement of the progress.
The minimum and maximum values displayable by the gauge can be set with the minimumValue and maximumValue properties.
Example:
You can create a custom appearance for a Gauge by assigning a GaugeStyle.

db:section.db:title: font : font
db:section.db:para: The font to use for the tickmark text.

db:section.db:title: formatValue : var
db:section.db:para: This property accepts a function that formats the given value for display in tickmarkLabel.
For example, to provide a custom format that displays all values with 3 decimal places:
The default function does no formatting.

db:section.db:title: maximumValue : alias
db:section.db:para: This property holds the largest value displayed by the gauge.
The default value is 100.

db:section.db:title: minimumValue : alias
db:section.db:para: This property holds the smallest value displayed by the gauge.
The default value is 0.

db:section.db:title: minorTickmarkCount : int
db:section.db:para: This property determines the amount of minor tickmarks drawn between each regular tickmark.
The default value is 4.

db:section.db:title: orientation : int
db:section.db:para: This property determines the orientation of the gauge.
The default value is Qt.Vertical.

db:section.db:title: style : Component
db:section.db:para: The style Component for this control.

db:member.db:link: Qt Quick Controls Styles QML Types

db:section.db:title: tickmarkAlignment : int
db:section.db:para: This property determines the alignment of each tickmark within the gauge. When orientation is Qt.Vertical, the valid values are:
Any other value will cause Qt.AlignLeft to be used, which is also the default value for this orientation.
When orientation is Qt.Horizontal, the valid values are:
Any other value will cause Qt.AlignBottom to be used, which is also the default value for this orientation.

db:section.db:title: tickmarkStepSize : real
db:section.db:para: This property determines the rate at which tickmarks are drawn on the gauge. The lower the value, the more often tickmarks are drawn.
The default value is 10.

db:section.db:title: value : alias
db:section.db:para: This property holds the value displayed by the gauge.
The default value is 0.
